_exec_summary.SummaryText:
AT PRAIRIE AG TAKE PRIDE IN OUR FACILITIES,  AND DO AS MUCH AS WE CAN TO ENSURE THAT  OUR FACILITIES ARE SANITARY AND SAFE.  ALL OF OUR AMMONIA FACILITIES ARE INSPECTED TWICE A YEAR BY STATE INSPECTORS AS WELL AS THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENTS.  THEY ARE KEPT UP TO DATE WITH ALL THE LATEST SAFETY EQUIPMENT REQUIRED BY CODES , STANDARDS AND LAWS.  ALL OF OUR EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED BY PRAIRIE AG TO COMPLETE A SAFETY TRAINING COURSE PUT ON BY IOWA AGRI BUSINESS ASSOCIATION OF IOWA SPECIFICALLY FOR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AS WELL AS OTHER AREAS OF THE BUSINESS. .                                                              1, FACILITY INFORMATION:  THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THIS LOCATION IS THE STORAGE AND SALE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA .   THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORED AT THIS FACILITY INCLUDES FOUR  STORAGE TANKS AND APPROXIMATLEY 65 NURSE TANKS.  500,000 POUNDS.  ANHYDROUS AMMOINIA IS LOADED INTO THE STOAGE TANKS ON THE WEST END OF THE TANKS.  THERE ARE TWO LOAD OUT RISERS, ONE EAST OF THE SOUTH STORAGE TANKS AND ONE NORTH OF THE STORAGE TANK SOUTH OF THE MAIN OFFICE.


 2. FACILITY POLOCY:  THE MANAGEMENT, EMPLOYEES AND OWNERS ARE COMMITED TO THE PREVENTION OF ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA .  THIS FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LEPC AND LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT  PERSONELL TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE TO THE ENVIRONMENT OF OUR COMMUNITY.  THIS RMP FACILITY IS OPPERATED WITH STAFF PRESENT DURING NORMAL WORKING HOURS.  DURING PERIODS OF NON OPERATION THIS FACILITY IS IS PATROLED BY LOCAL LAW INFORCEMENT AT VARIOUS TIMES OF THE NIGHT , WHERE ANYTHING OUT OF THE ORDINARY IS REPORTED TO OUR 24 HOUR TELEPHONE NUMBERS POSTED IN MANY AREAS OF OUR FACILITY AND APPROPIATE ACTION IS TAKEN.

3.  WORST CASE SCENERIO :  TOTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA FROM A STORAGE TANK THE DISTANCE TO END POINT WOULD BE APROXIMATELY 3 MILES. WE FILL ALL OF OUR STORAGE AND NURSE TANKSTO 85%. .                                                                                                                                                                    4.  ALTERNATIVE CASE SCENARIO:  A RELEASE FROM A BREAK IN A TRANSFER HOSE.  THE DISTANCE TO END POINT WOULD BE APPROXIMATELY .4 MILES.  OUR FACILITY HAS EXCESS FLOW VAVES IN THE TANKS AND LINES, AS WELL AS BREAK AWAY COUPLERS AT THE RISERS AND EMERGENCY SHUT OFF VALVES. .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        5.  FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:  THERE HASE BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASEES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT HAS CAUSED PROPERTY DAMAGE TO THE FACILITY, INJURIES OR DEATH ON OR OFF SITE, EVACUATIONS OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGES .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        6.  EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN:  OUR FACILITY COORDINATES WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENTS AND RESPONDERS. WE DO NOT PLAN TO HAVE OUR EMPLOYEES RESPOND TO A MAJOR RELEASE.  EACH YEAR WE PREPARE AN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN AND WILL CALL THE LEPC AND FIRE DEPARTMENTS FOR HELP IN CASE OF AN EMERGENCY.  .

7.  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM:  STORAGE TANKS AND NURSE TANKS ARE INSPECTED DAILEY TO ENSURE THAT VAVES ARE LOCKED AND HAVE NOT BEEN TAMPERED WITH, AND THAT ALL VALVES ARE TIGHTLY SHUT AND NOT LEAKING.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE ALSO PERFORMED TO ASSES THE MAINTENANCE OF EQUIPMENT AND SAFE CONDITIONS AT THE FACILITY. .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        8.   PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:  SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ONGOING PROCESS AT THIS FACILITY. AFTER PERIODIC EVALUATIONS  HAVE BEEN PERFORMED, WHATEVER NEEDS TO BE IMPLEMENTED TO IMPROVE THE SAFETY OF THIS FACILITY IS IMMEDIATLEY PUT INTO EFFECT. .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION CONTACT:  DARREN CADY (PRAIRIE AG COOP) 319 -865-1450
